intro: Cirsellium cancellatum, commonly known as the white wood betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, clustered white or pale blue flowers. It typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soil. Cirsellium cancellatum is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
